intro: Atraphaxis decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically covered in a fine, white powder, which helps reduce water loss in its harsh environment. Atraphaxis decipiens is adapted to survive in sandy soils and can tolerate extreme temperatures and drought conditions.
